sub_element_scores.rationale: Both title and comprehensive description present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Title: 'Artificial Intelligence Ready and Equitable Atlas for Diabetes Insights (AI-READI)', Description: 273 words, detailed and comprehensive

sub_element_scores.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_element_scores.rationale: 19 keywords present covering T2DM, AI/ML, multimodal data, equity, Bridge2AI
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Keywords include domain terms, methodology, demographics, specific technologies

sub_element_scores.rationale: Landing page URL present (https://fairhub.io/datasets/2), no hierarchical resources field
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Page URL matches dataset id, no nested sub-resources defined

sub_element_scores.rationale: license_and_use_terms present with comprehensive CC BY-NC 4.0 details, no ip_restrictions

sub_element_scores.rationale: No download_url field present, only landing page and access_urls in distribution_formats

sub_element_scores.rationale: distribution_formats present with 4 entries: DICOM, CSV, mHealth, REDCap
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Format types documented: DICOM (imaging), CSV (tabular), mHealth (wearables), REDCap (metadata)

sub_element_scores.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_element_scores.rationale: external_resources present with 9 resources, no related_datasets
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: External resources include: project website, docs, FAIRhub, Bridge2AI, NIH RePORTER, Zenodo, publications

sub_element_scores.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_element_scores.rationale: CC BY-NC 4.0 license with clear reuse terms: attribution required, non-commercial, derivatives permitted
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: License explicitly allows distribution, remix, adapt, build upon with proper citation

sub_element_scores.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_element_scores.rationale: Standardized formats documented: DICOM, CSV, mHealth standard
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Formats converted from proprietary (.fda, .sdt, .FIT) to standards (DICOM, mHealth)

sub_element_scores.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_element_scores.rationale: Neither conforms_to nor conforms_to_schema fields present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: No explicit schema conformance documented, though FAIR principles mentioned

sub_element_scores.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_element_scores.rationale: No variables field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Variable-level metadata not documented in D4D file, though REDCap data dictionary mentioned

sub_element_scores.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_element_scores.rationale: intended_uses (5 items) and discouraged_uses (3 items) present, no prohibited_uses
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Intended: AI/ML development, multimodal research, equity, biomarker discovery. Discouraged: pilot phase limitations, clinical use without validation, re-identification

sub_element_scores.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: human_subject_research present with IRB details: UW approval STUDY00016228, UAB and UCSD reliance agreements
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: IRB approval number format valid (STUDY00016228), three institutions documented, Community Advisory Board mentioned

sub_element_scores.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_element_scores.rationale: No is_deidentified field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Public dataset described as 'de-identified' in text but no structured deidentification metadata

sub_element_scores.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_element_scores.rationale: No participant_privacy field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Sensitive data controls mentioned (controlled access, data use agreement) but not in participant_privacy field

sub_element_scores.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_element_scores.rationale: Informed consent documented in human_subject_research.description: 'Written informed consent provided by all participants'
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Consent mentioned in prose, not as structured informed_consent field

sub_element_scores.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: vulnerable_populations documented in human_subject_research.special_populations: racial/ethnic minorities, tribal consultation planned
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Special populations include Asian, Black, Hispanic, Native American cohorts. No participant_compensation field

sub_element_scores.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_element_scores.rationale: subpopulations present with 8 groups: 4 race/ethnicity groups + 4 diabetes severity groups
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Triple-balanced design: Asian, Black, Hispanic, White x No diabetes, Pre-diabetes, Medication-controlled, Insulin-controlled

sub_element_scores.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_element_scores.rationale: instances present with participant details: 4,000 target enrollment, age 40+, triple-balanced sampling
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Target: 4,000 participants, each subpopulation ~1,000 (25%), recruitment 2020-2025

sub_element_scores.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_element_scores.rationale: Neither variables nor is_tabular fields present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Variable-level metadata not documented, though data described as tabular (CSV format)

sub_element_scores.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_element_scores.rationale: instances.instance_type describes conditions: T2DM, pre-diabetes, no diabetes
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Primary condition: Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus, severity levels from healthy to insulin-controlled

sub_element_scores.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: sampling_strategies present (1 detailed entry), no anomalies field
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Sampling: triple-balanced, non-random, non-representative, targeted recruitment. No documented anomalies

sub_element_scores.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_element_scores.rationale: No version field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Version numbers mentioned in updates (v1.0.0, v2.0.0, v3.0.0) but not in dedicated version field

sub_element_scores.name: Version Access Methods Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: No version_access field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Version-specific documentation mentioned (https://docs.aireadi.org/) but not structured version_access

sub_element_scores.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided
sub_element_scores.rationale: updates present with detailed update plan, no errata
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Updates: periodic releases, enrollment progress, final release November 2026, versioning implemented

sub_element_scores.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_element_scores.rationale: updates.frequency present: 'Periodic releases with ongoing enrollment; final release planned for late 2026'
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Frequency: periodic during enrollment (2020-2026), final release after 4,000 participants

sub_element_scores.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: Neither was_derived_from nor release_notes fields present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: D4D file has generation metadata but dataset provenance not documented

sub_element_scores.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation
sub_element_scores.rationale: purposes present with 3 detailed entries: T2DM salutogenesis, AI/ML standards, demographic equity
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Purposes comprehensive: hypothesis-agnostic ML research, FAIR standards establishment, addressing inequities

sub_element_scores.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks
sub_element_scores.rationale: tasks present with 3 entries: multimodal AI/ML, unbiased models, disease trajectories
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Tasks detailed: enable AI/ML across domains, prevent algorithmic bias, study progression pathways

sub_element_scores.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_element_scores.rationale: funders present with comprehensive NIH funding details
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Primary: NIH Common Fund Bridge2AI OT2OD032644, Additional: P30DK035816, UL1TR003096, Research to Prevent Blindness

sub_element_scores.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_element_scores.rationale: Grant IDs present: OT2OD032644, P30DK035816, UL1TR003096, Opportunity Number OTA-21-008
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Grant format valid (OT2, P30, UL1 prefixes), 2022 funding amount $5,026,499

sub_element_scores.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: creators present with 20 investigators including names, roles, affiliations
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Comprehensive team: PI Cynthia Owsley, Contact PI Aaron Lee, 18 Co-Investigators across 3 sites

sub_element_scores.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_element_scores.rationale: collection_mechanisms present with 5 detailed entries: in-person visits, EHR screening, wave-based recruitment, home monitoring, biospecimen collection
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Mechanisms comprehensive: single encounter, ICD-10 codes (R73.09, E11.X), wave-based sampling, CGM/wearables, biobanking

sub_element_scores.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_element_scores.rationale: acquisition_methods present with 12 detailed entries covering all data domains
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Methods comprehensive: surveys (REDCap), vitals, retinal imaging (5 devices), visual function, labs (CBC, EDTA, serum), ECG, cognitive (MoCA), neuropathy, CGM (Dexcom G6), wearables (Garmin), environmental sensors, biospecimens

sub_element_scores.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies
sub_element_scores.rationale: preprocessing_strategies (4 entries) and cleaning_strategies (1 entry) present, no labeling_strategies
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Preprocessing: harmonization, format conversion (DICOM, mHealth), biospecimen processing, QC. Cleaning: multi-site harmonization, FAIR compliance

sub_element_scores.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: No software_and_tools field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Tools mentioned in text (REDCap, Dexcom G6, Garmin, Optos, Spectralis, Cirrus, etc.) but not in structured field

sub_element_scores.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_element_scores.rationale: external_resources present with 9 detailed entries, no conforms_to
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Resources: project website, docs, FAIRhub, Bridge2AI, NIH RePORTER, Zenodo (10.5281/zenodo.10642459), BMJ Open (10.1136/bmjopen-2024-097449), Nature Metabolism

sub_element_scores.name: Known Limitations Documented
sub_element_scores.rationale: No known_limitations field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Limitations mentioned in discouraged_uses (pilot phase imbalance, cross-sectional design) but not structured known_limitations

sub_element_scores.name: Systematic Biases Identified and Described
sub_element_scores.rationale: No known_biases field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Sampling acknowledged as non-representative but not documented as known_biases

sub_element_scores.name: Data Anomalies and Quality Issues Noted
sub_element_scores.rationale: No anomalies field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Quality control measures documented but no specific anomalies reported

sub_element_scores.rationale: sensitive_elements present with 3 detailed entries, no content_warnings
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Sensitive: genetic/biospecimen data (controlled access), geographic/demographic identifiers (5-digit zip, race, sex), medical history/medications

sub_element_scores.name: Ethical Review Details Including Conflicts
sub_element_scores.rationale: ethical_reviews documented in human_subject_research: 3 IRBs, Community Advisory Board
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: IRB: UW (STUDY00016228), UAB reliance, UCSD reliance. CAB: 11 members, diverse race/ethnicity. No conflicts documented

sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Published on FAIRhub (https://fairhub.io/datasets/2) but no publisher field documenting this

sub_element_scores.rationale: No conforms_to field present
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: FAIR principles mentioned repeatedly but no structured conformance documentation

sub_element_scores.rationale: external_resources (9 entries) and page present with comprehensive links
sub_element_scores.semantic_notes: Resources: aireadi.org, docs.aireadi.org, fairhub.io, bridge2ai.org, reporter.nih.gov, zenodo.org, publications

identifier_validation.doi_notes: No DOI assigned to dataset, though related publications have DOIs

grant_format_validation.OT2OD032644: valid - NIH OT2 (Other Transaction Award) format
grant_format_validation.P30DK035816: valid - NIH P30 (Center Core Grant) format
grant_format_validation.UL1TR003096: valid - NIH UL1 (Clinical and Translational Science Award) format

grant_validation.notes: Comprehensive funding documentation with valid NIH grant formats

institutions: University of Alabama at Birmingham (reliance agreement)
University of California San Diego (reliance agreement)
irb_validation.notes: Multi-site IRB approval with reliance agreements, Community Advisory Board included

url_validation.notes: All URLs use HTTPS except Creative Commons license (HTTP by design)

participant_count_consistency.notes: 8 subpopulations (4 race/ethnicity x 4 diabetes severity) but cross-tabulated to 4,000 total (triple-balanced design)

site_consistency.notes: Three sites match creator affiliations, harmonized protocols

data_domain_consistency.notes: Multi-domain data collection comprehensively documented across acquisition and collection mechanisms

dataset_purpose.primary_goal: Understand salutogenesis (pathway from disease to health) in Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
dataset_purpose.methodology: Hypothesis-agnostic, harmonized, multi-domain dataset designed for AI/ML research
dataset_purpose.innovation: Triple-balanced sampling across race/ethnicity, biological sex, and diabetes severity to prevent algorithmic bias
dataset_purpose.impact: Establish standards for AI-ready medical datasets, address demographic inequities in T2DM research

data_modalities.integration_strategy: Multi-domain protocol harmonized across three sites, standardized operating procedures, centralized data management (REDCap)

ethical_framework.vulnerable_populations: Targeted recruitment of underrepresented racial/ethnic minorities in T2DM research
ethical_framework.data_governance: Data Access Committee developing policies, controlled access for sensitive data, public access for de-identified data

limitations: Pilot phase may have imbalanced data
Requires clinical validation before patient care use

high_priority_missing: doi: No DOI assigned to dataset
known_limitations: Limitations mentioned in text but not structured field
known_biases: Sampling biases not formally documented
publisher: FAIRhub not documented as publisher
medium_priority_missing: related_datasets: No relationships to other Bridge2AI datasets
is_deidentified: De-identification mentioned but not structured
participant_privacy: Privacy measures not formally documented
software_and_tools: Tools mentioned in text but not structured
conforms_to: FAIR principles mentioned but not formal conformance
version: Version numbers mentioned but not in version field
low_priority_missing: download_url: Access URLs in distribution_formats but not dedicated field
version_access: Version access methods not structured

strengths: Comprehensive scientific motivation and funding (100% element 7)
Detailed technical transparency with 12 acquisition methods (80% element 8)
Strong dataset composition with triple-balanced sampling (80% element 5)
Good discovery metadata with clear identifier and description (80% element 1)
Multi-institutional IRB approval with ethical oversight
Valid grant IDs with proper NIH format
Consistent documentation across sites, participants, and time periods
Clear AI/ML design principles and use cases
weaknesses: Poor cross-platform integration (20% element 10) - missing DOI, publisher, citation
Limited data provenance tracking (40% element 6) - no version field, version_access, or errata
Insufficient limitations disclosure (40% element 9) - no known_limitations, known_biases, or anomalies
No formal schema conformance documentation despite FAIR claims
No relationships to other datasets or hierarchical structure
Incomplete access metadata (no download_url, regulatory_restrictions, confidentiality_level)
De-identification and privacy measures mentioned but not formally documented
Software and tools mentioned extensively but not in structured field

critical: Assign DOI to dataset for persistent identification and citation
Add variable-level metadata (variables field) with data dictionary
Document known_limitations field with pilot phase constraints and cross-sectional design
Add publisher field documenting FAIRhub as platform
Create recommended citation field for proper attribution
important: Add version field with current version number
Document known_biases related to non-representative sampling
Add conforms_to field specifying FAIR principles and relevant standards
Document software_and_tools with structured entries for REDCap, imaging devices, wearables
Add is_deidentified field with de-identification method details
Document related_datasets linking to other Bridge2AI datasets (CM4AI, CHORUS, VOICE)
Add participant_privacy field documenting privacy protections beyond de-identification
optional: Consider RRID registration for broader discoverability
Add download_url field for direct download access
Document regulatory_restrictions if any export controls apply
Specify confidentiality_level for tiered access model
Add version_access field documenting how to access prior versions
Document errata as issues are discovered
Create release_notes for version change documentation
